seg-source.mrk: derby.user.UserName

target.mrk: derby.user.UserName

seg-source.mrk: derby.user

target.mrk: derby.user

seg-source.mrk: Users

target.mrk: Users

seg-source.mrk: creating

target.mrk: creating

seg-source.mrk: Function

target.mrk: Function

seg-source.mrk: Has two uses:

target.mrk: Has two uses:

trans-unit.source: Creates users and passwords when derby.authentication.provider is set to BUILTIN.

seg-source.mrk: Creates users and passwords when derby.authentication.provider is set to BUILTIN.

target.mrk: Creates users and passwords when derby.authentication.provider is set to BUILTIN.

trans-unit.source: Caches user DNs locally when derby.authentication.provider is set to LDAP and derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter is set to derby.user.

seg-source.mrk: Caches user DNs locally when derby.authentication.provider is set to LDAP and derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter is set to derby.user.

target.mrk: Caches user DNs locally when derby.authentication.provider is set to LDAP and derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter is set to derby.user.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s BUILTIN authentication mechanism is suitable only for development and testing purposes, and it will no longer be documented in future releases. It is strongly recommended that production systems rely on NATIVE authentication, an external directory service such as LDAP, or a user-defined class for authentication. It is also strongly recommended that production systems protect network connections with SSL/TLS.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s BUILTIN authentication mechanism is suitable only for development and testing purposes, and it will no longer be documented in future releases.
It is strongly recommended that production systems rely on NATIVE authentication, an external directory service such as LDAP, or a user-defined class for authentication.
It is also strongly recommended that production systems protect network connections with SSL/TLS.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s BUILTIN authentication mechanism is suitable only for development and testing purposes, and it will no longer be documented in future releases.
It is strongly recommended that production systems rely on NATIVE authentication, an external directory service such as LDAP, or a user-defined class for authentication.
It is also strongly recommended that production systems protect network connections with SSL/TLS.

seg-source.mrk: Users and Passwords

target.mrk: Users and Passwords

trans-unit.source: This property creates valid clear-text users and passwords within when the derby.authentication.provider property is set to BUILTIN. For information about users, see "Working with user authentication" in the .

seg-source.mrk: This property creates valid clear-text users and passwords within when the derby.authentication.provider property is set to BUILTIN.
For information about users, see "Working with user authentication" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

target.mrk: This property creates valid clear-text users and passwords within when the derby.authentication.provider property is set to BUILTIN.
For information about users, see "Working with user authentication" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: Database-Level Properties

target.mrk: Database-Level Properties

trans-unit.source: When you create users with database-level properties, those users are available to the specified database only.

seg-source.mrk: When you create users with database-level properties, those users are available to the specified database only.

target.mrk: When you create users with database-level properties, those users are available to the specified database only.

trans-unit.source: You set the property once for each user. To delete a user, set that user's password to null.

seg-source.mrk: You set the property once for each user.
To delete a user, set that user's password to null.

target.mrk: You set the property once for each user.
To delete a user, set that user's password to null.

seg-source.mrk: System-Level Properties

target.mrk: System-Level Properties

trans-unit.source: When you create users with system-level properties, those users are available to all databases in the system.

seg-source.mrk: When you create users with system-level properties, those users are available to all databases in the system.

target.mrk: When you create users with system-level properties, those users are available to all databases in the system.

trans-unit.source: You set the value of this system-wide property once for each user, so you can set it several times. To delete a user, remove that user from the file.

seg-source.mrk: You set the value of this system-wide property once for each user, so you can set it several times.
To delete a user, remove that user from the file.

target.mrk: You set the value of this system-wide property once for each user, so you can set it several times.
To delete a user, remove that user from the file.

trans-unit.source: You can define this property in the usual ways -- typically in the derby.properties file.

seg-source.mrk: You can define this property in the usual ways -- typically in the derby.properties file.

target.mrk: You can define this property in the usual ways -- typically in the derby.properties file.

trans-unit.source: When a user name and its corresponding password are provided in the DriverManager.getConnection call, validates them against the properties defined for the current system.

seg-source.mrk: When a user name and its corresponding password are provided in the DriverManager.getConnection call, validates them against the properties defined for the current system.

target.mrk: When a user name and its corresponding password are provided in the DriverManager.getConnection call, validates them against the properties defined for the current system.

trans-unit.source: User names are SQL92Identifiers and can be delimited.

seg-source.mrk: User names are SQL92Identifiers and can be delimited.

target.mrk: User names are SQL92Identifiers and can be delimited.

seg-source.mrk: Syntax

target.mrk: Syntax

seg-source.mrk: derby.user.{UserName=Password} | UserName=userDN }

target.mrk: derby.user.{UserName=Password} | UserName=userDN }

seg-source.mrk: -- database-level property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.user.UserName', 'Password | userDN')

target.mrk: -- database-level property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.user.UserName', 'Password | userDN')

seg-source.mrk: Default

target.mrk: Default

seg-source.mrk: None.

target.mrk: None.

seg-source.mrk: Example

target.mrk: Example

seg-source.mrk: -- system-level property derby.user.guest=java5w

target.mrk: -- system-level property derby.user.guest=java5w

trans-unit.source: derby.user.sa=3x9 derby.user."!Amber"=java5w -- database-level property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.user.sa', '3x9') -- cache a userDN locally, database-level property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.user.richard', 'uid=richard, ou=People, o=example.com')

seg-source.mrk: derby.user.sa=3x9 derby.user."!Amber"=java5w -- database-level property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.user.sa', '3x9') -- cache a userDN locally, database-level property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.user.richard', 'uid=richard, ou=People, o=example.com')

target.mrk: derby.user.sa=3x9 derby.user."!Amber"=java5w -- database-level property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.user.sa', '3x9') -- cache a userDN locally, database-level property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.user.richard', 'uid=richard, ou=People, o=example.com')

seg-source.mrk: Dynamic or static

target.mrk: Dynamic or static

trans-unit.source: Dynamic; the change takes effect immediately. For information about dynamic changes to properties, see <xref href="crefproperdynstat.dita#crefproperdynstat"/>.

seg-source.mrk: Dynamic; the change takes effect immediately.
For information about dynamic changes to properties, see <xref href="crefproperdynstat.dita#crefproperdynstat"/>.

target.mrk: Dynamic; the change takes effect immediately.
For information about dynamic changes to properties, see <xref href="crefproperdynstat.dita#crefproperdynstat"/>.
